text: :For commune in Romania see Supur Supur is a village under Raipur-Supur gram panchayat in Bolpur Sriniketan CD block in Bolpur subdivision of Birbhum district, West Bengal, India. ==History== As per mythology, in ancient times, Supur was the capital of Raja Surath. Some 150 years ago or a little earlier, Supur and Surul were better known places than Bolpur, then a small village, and Shantiniketan did not exist.Ghosh, Binoy, Paschim Banger Sanskriti, , part I, 1976 edition, page 298, Prakash Bhaban, Kolkata ==Geography== ===Location=== Supur is located at . ==Demographics== As per the 2011 Census of India, Supur had a total population of 1,803 of which 910 (50%) were males and 893 (50%) were females. Population below 6 years was 220. The total number of literates in Supur was 1,096 (69.24% of the population over 6 years). ==Transport== Supur is on National Highway 114.Google maps Twin Shiva temples ==Culture== As seen in the photograph (alongside) there are two Shiva temples at Supur, referred to as twin Shiva temples. David J. McCutchion mentions that one of them is a 19th century ridged rekha deul, with rich terracotta decoration on all sides. The other one is a rekha deul with ridged turrets.McCutchion, David J., Late Mediaeval Temples of Bengal, first published 1972, reprinted 2017, pages 48 & 59\. The Asiatic Society, Kolkata, ==Healthcare== There is a primary health centre at Supur (with 10 beds). ==References== Category:Villages in Birbhum district
title: Supur, Birbhum
